item.title: Fakhrul sees new opportunity to build liberal democratic Bangladesh
item.description: BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir on Saturday said a new scope has opened before the nation to build a liberal democratic Bangladesh. “People are now hopeful as a scope has been created for building a liberal democratic Bangladesh,” he said. Fakhrul made the remarks wh

item.title: Gas valve burst causes pressure drop, disrupting supply across Dhaka
item.description: A sharp drop in gas pressure has disrupted supply across Dhaka after a key valve exploded on the distribution line. Residents in areas including Dhanmondi, Mohammadpur, Shyamoli, New Market, Hazaribagh and Gabtoli are receiving little or no gas supply. State-run distributor Titas Gas said the pro

item.title: Tasnim Jara gets back candidacy on appeal
item.description: Tasnim Jara, a former National Citizen Party (NCP) leader, regained her candidacy status on Saturday, the first day of the appeal hearing. The Election Commission has upheld the candidacies of Tasnim Jara and Jamaat-e-Islami's AHM Hamidur Rahman Azad for the upcoming national election. The decisi

item.title: International Conference on Mother Language and Awards 2026 held at Nalanda Open University
item.description: A two-day international conference focusing on mother language, human rights, peace, and press freedom was held on January 4–5 at Nalanda Open University in Rajgir, Bihar. The event was jointly organized by Nalanda Open University and the SAARC Journalists Forum. Titled International Confere

item.title: 'We don't want to go back to pre-Aug 5 days': Tarique
item.description: BNP leader Tarique Rahman has said there is “no reason” for the country to return to the political conditions that existed before the toppling of the Awami League regime on August 5, 2024. “We don’t want to go back to pre-August 5 days. There’s no reason for us to do

item.title: Titas begins repair work to restore gas supply
item.description: State-run distributor Titas Gas Transmission and Distribution PLC on Saturday began repair work on a damaged gas valve on Mirpur Road and a gas pipeline under the Turag River to restore normal gas supply in the city. According to a Titas Gas press release issued today, a four-inch diameter valve i

item.title: NASA cuts space station mission due to astronaut's health issue
item.description: In a rare move, NASA is cutting a mission aboard the International Space Station short after an astronaut had a medical issue. The space agency said Thursday the US-Japanese-Russian crew of four will return to Earth in the coming days, earlier than planned. NASA cancelled its first spacewalk of t

item.title: China, Russia, Iran start 'BRICS Plus' naval exercises in South African waters
item.description:
China, Russia and Iran began a week of joint naval exercises in South Africa's waters on Saturday in what the host country described as a BRICS Plus operation to "ensure the safety of shipping and maritime economic activities".
BRICS Plus is an expansion of a geopolitical bloc originally c

item.title: Cox's Bazar-2: Jamaat’s Hamidur Rahman Azad gets candidacy back
item.description: The Election Commission on Saturday declared the candidature of Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islam’s aspirant for Cox’s Bazar-2 AHM Hamidur Rahman Azad valid after hearing his appeal petition. Earlier, the returning officer concerned declared his nomination paper invalid during the scrutiny, UN

item.title: Tigers act normal despite controversies, says Shanto
item.description: Bangladesh players are often forced to mask the impact of controversies in the build-up to, and during, major tournaments, despite how the external noise affects them, Test captain Najmul Hossain Shanto said. Uncertainty looms over Bangladesh’s participation in the Twenty20 World Cup followi

item.title: Banglalink launches nationwide Wi-Fi calling service
item.description: Banglalink, the country’s leading innovative digital operator, has officially launched its nationwide Voice over Wi Fi (VoWiFi) calling service, enabling customers across Bangladesh to make high quality voice calls using Wi Fi alongside mobile networks.
